14
15#ifndef ISC_RATELIMITER_H
16#define ISC_RATELIMITER_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file isc/ratelimiter.h
23 * \brief A rate limiter is a mechanism for dispatching events at a limited
24 * rate. This is intended to be used when sending zone maintenance
25 * SOA queries, NOTIFY messages, etc.
26 */
27
28/***
29 *** Imports.
30 ***/
31
32#include <inttypes.h>
33#include <stdbool.h>
34
35#include <isc/lang.h>
36#include <isc/types.h>
37
38ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
39
40/*****
41 ***** Functions.
42 *****/
43
44isc_result_t
45isc_ratelimiter_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_timermgr_t *timermgr,
46 isc_task_t *task, isc_ratelimiter_t **ratelimiterp);
47/*%<
48 * Create a rate limiter. The execution interval is initially undefined.
49 */
50
51isc_result_t
52isc_ratelimiter_setinterval(isc_ratelimiter_t *rl, isc_interval_t *interval);
53/*!<
54 * Set the minimum interval between event executions.
55 * The interval value is copied, so the caller need not preserve it.
56 *
57 * Requires:
58 * '*interval' is a nonzero interval.
59 */
60
61void
62isc_ratelimiter_setpertic(isc_ratelimiter_t *rl, uint32_t perint);
63/*%<
64 * Set the number of events processed per interval timer tick.
65 * If 'perint' is zero it is treated as 1.
66 */
67
68void
69isc_ratelimiter_setpushpop(isc_ratelimiter_t *rl, bool pushpop);
70/*%<
71 * Set / clear the ratelimiter to from push pop mode rather
72 * first in - first out mode (default).
73 */
74
75isc_result_t
76isc_ratelimiter_enqueue(isc_ratelimiter_t *rl, isc_task_t *task,
77 isc_event_t **eventp);
78/*%<
79 * Queue an event for rate-limited execution.
80 *
81 * This is similar
82 * to doing an isc_task_send() to the 'task', except that the
83 * execution may be delayed to achieve the desired rate of
84 * execution.
85 *
86 * '(*eventp)->ev_sender' is used to hold the task. The caller
87 * must ensure that the task exists until the event is delivered.
88 *
89 * Requires:
90 *\li An interval has been set by calling
91 * isc_ratelimiter_setinterval().
92 *
93 *\li 'task' to be non NULL.
94 *\li '(*eventp)->ev_sender' to be NULL.
95 */
96
97isc_result_t
98isc_ratelimiter_dequeue(isc_ratelimiter_t *rl, isc_event_t *event);
99/*
100 * Dequeue a event off the ratelimiter queue.
101 *
102 * Returns:
103 * \li ISC_R_NOTFOUND if the event is no longer linked to the rate limiter.
104 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
105 */
106
107void
108isc_ratelimiter_shutdown(isc_ratelimiter_t *ratelimiter);
109/*%<
110 * Shut down a rate limiter.
111 *
112 * Ensures:
113 *\li All events that have not yet been
114 * dispatched to the task are dispatched immediately with
115 * the #ISC_EVENTATTR_CANCELED bit set in ev_attributes.
116 *
117 *\li Further attempts to enqueue events will fail with
118 * #ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN.
119 *
120 *\li The rate limiter is no longer attached to its task.
121 */
122
123void
124isc_ratelimiter_attach(isc_ratelimiter_t *source, isc_ratelimiter_t **target);
125/*%<
126 * Attach to a rate limiter.
127 */
128
129void
130isc_ratelimiter_detach(isc_ratelimiter_t **ratelimiterp);
131/*%<
132 * Detach from a rate limiter.
133 */
134
135isc_result_t
136isc_ratelimiter_stall(isc_ratelimiter_t *rl);
137/*%<
138 * Stall event processing.
139 */
140
141isc_result_t
142isc_ratelimiter_release(isc_ratelimiter_t *rl);
143/*%<
144 * Release a stalled rate limiter.
145 */
146
147ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
148
149#endif /* ISC_RATELIMITER_H */
150
